image.altText: woman smiles in front of trees

props.synopsis: Greens incumbent Laura Nuttall has won the fifth and final seat in the Tuggeranong-based electorate of Brindabella, as Labor minister Mick Gentleman is defeated.

title.children: Greens MLA Laura Nuttall wins final seat in Brindabella

image.altText: Missing man David Aboui was last seen on London Circuit in Canberra on July 10 2012. Supplied: AFP

props.synopsis: Malak Arok was last seen leaving the ACT Watch House in July 2012.

title.children: 'We can't do anything': Family pleads for answers over Canberra man missing for 12 years

image.altText: A man walks through journalists and cameras.

props.synopsis: Bruce Lehrmann is able to appeal against the result of his failed defamation case, after a Federal Court judge dismissed an application for him to pay a security of costs before any appeal goes ahead.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann cleared to proceed with defamation case appeal

image.altText: Light beams from a twisting silver sculpture with a wide opening outside an art gallery at night.

props.synopsis: Lindy Lee's sculpture Ouroboros, based on the ancient tale of the same name about a snake swallowing its own tail, is the National Gallery of Australia's largest ever investment in a single artwork.

title.children: National Gallery of Australia's single most expensive artwork Ouroboros unveiled to the public

image.altText: Two make grain silos collapsed with grain pouring into the Shoalhaven River

props.synopsis: SafeWork NSW is investigating how two wheat silos containing thousands of tonnes of grain collapsed last week, causing major structural damage at Manildra's south coast processing plant.Â

title.children: Grain clean-up to take weeks amid investigations into NSW South Coast silo collapse

image.altText: Person with wings jumping off a pier.

props.synopsis: With Labor set to form government in the ACT, what exactly did the party promise voters during the election campaign?

title.children: Following Labor's victory, here's what they promised in the lead-up to the ACT election

image.altText: A building with mult-coloured exterior.

props.synopsis: Aleu Mapiou, found not guilty by reason of mental impairment to murdering another patient while inside the Canberra Hospital Adult Mental Health Unit, will be involuntarily detained at a secure mental health facility.

title.children: Canberra man found not guilty of murdering fellow mental health unit patient by reason of mental impairment

image.altText: Two cardboard boxes labelled MEMPHIS 100 menthol tubes sit on a table, cigarettes unpacked on top

props.synopsis: New South Wales will unveil long-awaited changes today in a bid to penalise tobacconists selling illegal cigarettes and crack down on the growing black market.Â

title.children: There's a reason so many dodgy tobacco shops are popping up across NSW â this is the plan to fix it

image.altText: Farmer standing in a field with a phone.

props.synopsis: There are concerns thousands of phones, medical devices, mobile phone boosters in cars, location devices in trucks and farm equipment may stop working.Â

title.children: The 3G network is about to shut down for good, so what will stop working from Monday?

image.altText: Liz Watson and Gretel Bueta of Australia hugging after winning netball gold medal

props.synopsis: Glasgow has stepped up to host the 2026 Commonwealth Games but with just over half the number of sports remaining and cost blowouts putting off other countries, do the Games have a future?

title.children: Will Glasgow 2026 be the last Commonwealth Games?

image.altText: A composite of Donald Trump and Kamala Harris against a backdrop of a globe.

props.synopsis: From war in the Middle East and Europe, to the geo-strategic complexities of our own region, America's election outcome will change the world. Our ABC correspondents break down what could follow either a Donald Trump or Kamala Harris victory.Â

title.children: The world stands at a crossroads. Our foreign correspondents predict where Trump or Harris could take us next

image.altText: Composite image of Premier Steven Miles and Opposition Leader David Crisafulli

props.synopsis: With polls set to open in less than 24 hours, signs are emerging that tomorrow's Queensland election result might not be as clear-cut as predicted.

title.children: Signs the ground has shifted in Queensland's election campaign ahead of Saturday's vote

image.altText: Man stands at podium addressing room

props.synopsis: Brian Bieber, the lawyer for Mr Jeffries, had earlier said in an interview that his client would plead not guilty to all counts he faces.

title.children: Former Abercrombie & Fitch CEO Mike Jeffries pleads not guilty to sex trafficking charges

image.altText: The main street of Broken Hill in the dark with stars shining overhead.

props.synopsis: More than a week after a possible tornado tore through Broken Hill and wiped out seven transmission towers, the region is still grappling with rolling blackouts that are putting dialysis patients like Leroy and year 12 students studying for exams like Poppy on edge.Â

title.children: The town where 'power could go off any minute' grapples with continual outages

image.altText: a young woman looks at the camera

props.synopsis: Maddie was 19 when the hot flashes and mood swings started.

title.children: Menopause in her early 20s made Maddie feel she was losing her youth and womanhood

image.altText: POKIES

props.synopsis: A new report published in an international medical journal reveals that the global health impacts of gambling are much worse than previously understood.

title.children: The health impact of gambling worldwide is much worse than previously known, international research says

image.altText: A black and white photo of two young men standing outside a house

props.synopsis: The Menendez brothers' case gripped America in the 1990s. Here is how these two brothers went from being the arch-villains of the country's burgeoning true crime obsession, to the focus of an impassioned movement to free them.

title.children: Maligned as greedy âcrybabyâ killers, the Menendez brothers have a new chance at freedom. Here's what changed

image.altText: Caitlin Foord of Australia controls the ball under pressure from Geraldine Reuteler during an international friendly

props.synopsis: The Matildas' new era has begun with a 1-1 draw against Switzerland, in front of a record crowd in Zurich.

title.children: Matildas with work to do after 1-1 draw with Switzerland

image.altText: Oscar Piastri in the garage, putting in ear plugs before he goes out to race

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri has been quick to shut down growing suggestions that his management team are manoeuvring for him to make a move from McLaren to Red Bull.

title.children: Piastri shuts down talk of move from McLaren to champions Red Bull

image.altText: Adam Bray, right, and Zach Bray who died in the hunter bus crash of June 11, 2023

props.synopsis: The father of a man killed in the crash is leading a class action against Transport for NSW, in which claim documents suggest the roundabout's "tightening radius" contributed to the tragedy.

title.children: Roundabout design and 'inadequate' signage key to Hunter Valley bus crash victims' class action

image.altText: A massive pile of cannabis on fire

props.synopsis: More than 6,500 cannabis plants have been seized in the Gippsland region and burned in what police say is one of the biggest hauls in recent time.

title.children: Police seize $26 million illegal cannabis crop in country Victoria

image.altText: A man wearing glasses is shown surrounded journalists holding phones

props.synopsis: Investigators allege more than $6.8 billion was stolen from the fund and laundered by Najib Razak's associates to finance Hollywood films and extravagant purchases.Â

title.children: Corrupt Malaysian leader says sorry for looting of state investment fund â while reiterating innocence

image.altText: A render of a ship's cabin with large rectangular porthole, beige couch and dog bed.

props.synopsis: Tasmania finds itself in a farcical position where the brand-new Spirit of Tasmania ferries it purchased may end up being hand-me-downs by the time they reach the state's shores.

title.children: Tasmanians will have to sit back and watch someone else use their $850m brand-new Spirit ferries

image.altText: A ruined city neighbourhood with people walking with bikes and on foot amid rubble-strewn streets

props.synopsis: A Hamas official says the militant group is "ready to stop fighting" if Israel agrees to ceasefire terms in Gaza.

title.children: Hamas and Israel to negotiate possible ceasefire deal in Doha

image.altText: Joao Carlan with family

props.synopsis: Some Australians might take the opportunity to vote for granted, but for new citizens, it can be a privilege to head to the ballot box in a safe democracy.

title.children: Thousands of new Australian citizens ready to vote in Queensland election

image.altText: A screengrab of a webpage showing flights over the Middle East.

props.synopsis: As Israel and Iran trade blows in the Middle East, commercial aircraft traversing the region are doing so through fewer corridors to avoid getting caught in the crossfire.

title.children: Missiles flying between Israel and Iran have the aviation industry concerned about getting caught in the crossfire

image.altText: truck into house

props.synopsis: Emergency services were called to reports a truck veered from the road and crashed into a house on the Princes Highway just after 7am. A man and woman in their 80s inside the house died at the scene.

title.children: Two people killed in bedroom of their home after truck veers off highway in Victoria's south-west

image.altText: An AI image of a man in a radio station

props.synopsis: One of Poland's leading state broadcasters has come under fire after it launched a new radio program presented solely by artificial intelligence (AI) presenters, weeks after dismissing dozens of creators.Â

title.children: This Polish radio station dismissed its presenters and turned to AI. Then they interviewed a dead poet

image.altText: Close-up of moldy bread slices, showcasing the detailed texture and various colors of mold growth on the surface.

props.synopsis: Have you ever been tempted to cut off a mouldy corner of cheese? You might be throwing together a last-minute meal and trying to avoid a trip to the shops. Maybe one of your parents would insist it was "still good". But is it?

title.children: Tempted to cut mould off cheese or scrape some off jam? Here's what the experts have to say about it

image.altText: A side profile of an Indigenous woman with a painted face.

props.synopsis: Arthurina Moreen's desire was so great to play footy, she'd practice by kicking bottles with her bare feet. A new documentary has shone a light on her resilience, and that of three other Tiwi Islander women as they chase AFLW stardom.

title.children: 'I started by kicking bottles': Documentary follows young Indigenous women chasing AFLW dreams

image.altText: Damaged car parked in front of house with broken window

props.synopsis: A community meeting has been held in Meekatharra to address what police describe as a recent increase in youth-related crime and antisocial behaviour.

title.children: 'There is no control': Outback residents' frustration amid uptick in juvenile crime

props.synopsis: Grain and oilseed growers in northern NSW look to the skies and hope the weather cooperates to produce a stand-out harvest this year with the success credited to a full moisture profile at sowing and consistent and timely rain throughout the growing season.

title.children: Grain growers in northern NSW say this season's crops could be 'spectacular'

image.altText: Man loses his popcorn because he gets startled with fright

props.synopsis: From a twisted take on Freaky Friday to a deeply satisfying 'eat the rich' fable, here are some Halloween movies that might give you a jolt but won't keep you up at night.

title.children: Too scared to watch horror movies? Here are 5 to ease you into the genre
